ok, that is still openJDK, not the sun version
have you done "sudo apt-get install sun-java6-jdk" ?
If not yet, then do so to install the sun jdk
should I try to uninstall it and then reinstall the jdk package form repos then?
uninstalling the other version is not required. Just run "sudo apt-get install sun-java6-jdk"
it says the latest version is already installed
ok, so it IS installed. Then you have to set it as default. type "sudo update-alternatives --list java"
OK, I've got Java 6-sun and java-6-openjdk ... I guess I should use the first one as default. How do I switch?
indeed. Run "sudo update-alternatives --config java", then choose for the sun thing. Then try java -version again
I believe it's done. Thank you very much for your help
you're welcome

sure, if you really want it gone, "sudo apt-get remove openjdk-6-jdk" <-- if that is the correct packagename....
